ygData.subject: Re: Dual Bard Invisibility Question
ygData.msgSnippet: I encountered this also when I was camping the Icy Greaves in Perma a while back.  Another bard and I were grouped, I sang Invis while he sang See Invis.  Both
ygData.messageBody:
I encountered this also when I was camping the Icy Greaves in Perma a while
back. Another bard and I were grouped, I sang Invis while he sang See
Invis. Both seemed to stack with each other nicely

-=B=-
-----Original Message-----
From: eqreed@... <eqreed@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, January 04, 2000 11:33 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Dual Bard Invisibility Question


>From: eqreed@...
>
>I've read on the Bard Song Analysis page, that in a 2 bard party, you
cannot
>have one singing invisibility, and the other singing any other song (such
as
>healing, or see invis, etc.)
>
>Quotes:
>
>"[Ziann] With 2 bards in the group... if you get separated and both are
singing
>invis you will go visible for a pulse when meeting up. Also on the same
note
>you can not have 2 bards singing invis at the same time as both bards will
go
>visible on the song pulses. This can be deadly when you are deep in a
place
>like Mistmoore Castle."
>
>"[Kaearia] Any song will allow mobs to see you even if you are still
>invisible. e.g. If one bard is singing this song, and another is singing
Hymn,
>the mobs can see you."
>
>However, my experience in a 2 bard party last night would seem to indicate
>differently. We seemed to be invis, and healing at the same time.
>
>Has anyone done any tests with this?
>
> - Reed (E'ci)
>
>>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
